hypothesis_content.title: Bear Regime Low-Volume Rally Exhaustion Signal
hypothesis_content.statement: In a BEAR regime, a 4-hour price rally of >4% on volume (in USD) that is lower than the median volume of the preceding 10 bear-market 4-hour candles will reverse and give up >50% of its gains within the next two 4-hour candles.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In a sustained bear regime, high-conviction buying is scarce. A sharp price move on sub-par volume is characteristic of short-covering or weak-handed longs, not new institutional demand. This creates a 'bear market rally' trap. The strong close entices late momentum buyers, who then become immediate sellers on any stall, leading to a swift and predictable retracement. The timing edge is shorting the exhaustion of the low-volume spike.
entry_conditions: 4-hour candle USD volume < median(volume, lookback=10 candles, regime=BEAR)
Candle closes in the top 30% of its 4-hour range (strong close)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price declines to a level that retraces 50% of the signal candle's range (from open to close).
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price moves above the high of the signal candle.
exit_conditions.time_exit: 8 hours (two 4-hour candles) after entry signal close.

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 60% of such signals continue to rally, with the next two candles failing to retrace 50% of the signal candle's gains.
